meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a cat in behavior or mannerisms.
meanings.sent1: Her movements were cattish, graceful and quiet.
meanings.sent2: The way he curled up on the couch was cattish, just like a feline.
meanings.sent3: The cattish way she purred when she got her favorite treat was adorable.
meanings.sent4: His cattish gaze seemed to see right through me, as if he knew all my secrets.
meanings.sent5: The cattish behavior of the stray kitten made it impossible not to smile.

meanings.definition: Showing sly or spiteful behavior, like a cat.
meanings.sent1: She gave me a cattish smile, hinting at mischief.
meanings.sent2: His cattish remarks were meant to provoke a reaction.
meanings.sent3: The cattish look in her eyes told me she was up to something mischievous.
meanings.sent4: Her cattish behavior at the party caused quite a stir among the guests.
meanings.sent5: The cattish way he played tricks on his friends showed his playful side.
